name: samtools_mpileup
title: Samtools Pileup
summary: Variant calling for SNPs and Indels using Samtools Pileup
description: Samtools pileup takes a set of mapped reads and calls SNP and indels variations from a reference genome, using the mpileup option of samtools.

inputs.name: mappings
inputs.label: Mappings Object
inputs.help: The mapped reads which will be used to call variants from

inputs.name: reference
inputs.label: Reference Genome
inputs.help: The reference genome to call variants against

inputs.name: output name
inputs.label: Output Name
inputs.help: The name of the generated variants object

inputs.name: disable_probabilistic_realignment
inputs.label: No Realignment
inputs.help: When this option is selection mpileup will not attempt to realign potentially misaligned reads. Turning this off will increase the false positive rate

inputs.name: excessive_mismatch_penalty
inputs.label: Mismatch Penalty
inputs.help: This coefficient is used to downgrade the mapping quality of reads containing multiple mismatches

inputs.name: max_reads_per_position
inputs.label: Max Coverage
inputs.help: For each position, samtools will consider at most this many reads

inputs.name: extended_baq_computation
inputs.label: Extend Quality Computation
inputs.help: Extra re-computation of base quality for mapped reads. Selecting this will slightly improve sensitivity, especially for MNP, but slightly decrease specifcity

inputs.name: minimum_mapping_quality
inputs.label: Min Mapping Quality
inputs.help: Mapped quality of an alignment must be above this threshold to be considered

inputs.name: minimum_base_quality
inputs.label: Min Base Quality
inputs.help: Base read quality must be above this threshold to be considered

inputs.name: bayesian_inference
inputs.label: Use Bayesian Model
inputs.help: If selected, a bayesian model will be used to call variants. Selecting this will force the option for maximum-likelihood inference for genotypes

inputs.name: perform_max_likelihood_inference
inputs.label: Use max-likelihood
inputs.help: Perform max-likelihood inference only, including estimating the site allele frequency, testing Hardy-Weinberg equlibrium and testing associations with LRT

inputs.name: indel_to_snp_ratio
inputs.label: Indel:SNP Ratio
inputs.help: Assume this ratio for the prior of the ratio of Indels to SNPs

inputs.name: variant_probability
inputs.label: Variant Call Probability
inputs.help: Call a variant if its probability is estimated at greater than this

inputs.name: scaled_mutation_rate
inputs.label: Mutation Rate
inputs.help: Prior used for likelihood of finding variants

inputs.name: output_variants_only
inputs.label: Output Only Variants
inputs.help: If selected, reference calls will not be printed

inputs.name: retain_unlikely_alleles
inputs.label: Keep Unlikely Alleles
inputs.help: If selected, alleles mpileup considers but rejects as unlikely will be retained

inputs.name: compress_reference
inputs.label: Compress Reference
inputs.help: When selected, contiguous rows that are called as reference will be compressed to a single row to save space

inputs.name: infer_no_call
inputs.label: Infer No-call Sites
inputs.help: When selected, positions in the reference genome lacking any calls will be explicitly written to the variants object as no-call

inputs.name: store_full_vcf
inputs.label: Store All VCF Data
inputs.help: When selected, extra data beyond that stored in the simplevar variants object will be retained to allow for a full reconstitution of the VCF file

inputs.name: intervals_to_process
inputs.label: Process Intervals
inputs.help: If given, mpileup will only call variants on these regions. Input must be a string of format "-L chr:lo-hi" which can have as many -L arguments as desired

inputs.name: intervals_to_exclude
inputs.label: Exclude Intervals
inputs.help: If given, mpileup will not call variants on these regions. Input must be a string of format "-L chr:lo-hi" which can have as many -L arguments as desired
